Yintong Shang

A senior undergraduate student fascinated by and dedicated to computer graphics. I aspire to be a technical artist, who grasps knowledge and skills in both art and programming.

Interests

computer graphics, simulation and physics-based animation, shape reconstrution, physics-based rendering

Experiences

Research Project: Precise Calibration and Modeling of Piezo-resistive Textile 2020.3-2021.9

Advisor: Prof. Jingyuan Cheng, School of Computer Science and Technology, USTC

◦ Realized a mathematical model to predict the nonlinear behavior of piezoresistive textile

◦ Built a finite-element physical model of the textile

Education

Bachelor of Engineering in Electronic Science and Technology at University of Science and Technology of China, 2018-2022

Skills

◦ Python (4000 lines, including Taichi)

◦ C++ (3000 lines, including OpenGL)

◦ C# (1200 lines, for Unity)

◦ MATLAB (500 lines)

◦ COMSOL (finite-element simulation, on Structural Mechanics and Electromagnetics)

◦ Cinema 4D (created animations for fun)
